intro: Bignonia verrucifera, commonly known as the velvetleaf bignonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its stems are typically woody and can grow攀援 or as shrubs, depending on the environment. Bignonia verrucifera is often found in moist, sunny habitats such as forests and along streambanks.
